Context: Cicuta bulbifera commonly known as the bulb-bearing water-hemlock is a plant native to North America and one of four species in the poisonous genus Cicuta. Cicuta bulbifera can be distinguished from Cicuta douglasii by its narrow leaflet segments (less than 1/4 of an inch wide) and its bulbil-bearing upper leaf axils.
